metadata.title: CVE-2023-52847 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: media:bttv: fix use after free error due to btv->timeout timer There may be somea race condition between timer function bttv_irq_timeout and bttv_remove.The timer is setup in probe and there is no timer_delete operation inremove function. When it hit kfree btv, the function might still beinvoked, which will cause use after free bug. This bug is found by staticanalysis, it may be false positive. Fix it by adding del_timer_syncinvoking to the remove function. cpu0 cpu1 bttv_probe ->timer_setup->bttv_set_dma ->mod_timer; bttv_remove ->kfree(btv); ->bttv_irq_timeout->USE btv

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52847` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
